articleContent.title: Chord: 11th in D# (Shape: A)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: 11th in D# (Shape: A)

## Description
The 11th chord in D# (Shape: A) is a rich and colorful chord that adds depth and sophistication to a musical piece. This chord is a complex and harmonically intriguing chord that can provide a smooth and jazzy sound or a dreamy and ethereal atmosphere, depending on how it is used.

## Notes and Intervals
The 11th chord in D# consists of the following notes and intervals:
- D# (Root)
- G (Major third)
- A# (Perfect fifth)
- F (Major 9th)
- C (Perfect 11th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The 11th chord in D# (Shape: A) is often used in genres such as jazz, R&B, and neo-soul. It adds a sense of sophistication and complexity to the music, creating a lush and vibrant harmonic texture. This chord can introduce a sense of tension and release, as well as a dreamy and otherworldly quality to the music.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the 11th chord in D# (Shape: A):
1. **"So What" by Miles Davis:** This iconic jazz composition features the 11th chord in D# in various harmonic progressions, showcasing its versatility and depth.
2. **"Sumthin' Sumthin'" by Maxwell:** This neo-soul classic uses the 11th chord in D# to create a soulful and groovy atmosphere, adding an element of sophistication to the music.
3. **"Redbone" by Childish Gambino:** In this R&B/funk track, the 11th chord in D# is used to create a smooth and funky vibe, contributing to the overall retro and funky flavor of the song.
